capability_questions.question: Manage Registry Capability Question Is the process primarily manual or automatic? use standards in the process? process?

levels.level_1: paper-based activity to accomplish tasks. SMA focuses on meeting compliance thresholds for state and federal regulations using state-specific standards. Very little collaboration occurs with other agencies to standardize information exchange or business tasks.
levels.level_2: automatic processes to accomplish tasks. SMA applies a mix of HIPAA and state- specific standards. SMA collaborates with other agencies and entities to adopt HIPAA standards and Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) transactions. Manage Registry
levels.level_3: extent possible within the intrastate. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for intrastate exchange of registry information. SMA collaborates with other intrastate registry agencies and entities to adopt national standards, and to develop and share reusable
levels.level_4: the extent possible across the interstate. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for clinical and interstate information exchange of regional registry information. SMA collaborates with other regional registry agencies and entities to adopt national standards, and to develop and share reusable
levels.level_5: to the extent possible across the nation. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for national exchange of registry information. SMA collaborates with national agencies and entities for national (and international) interoperability improvements that

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Timeliness of Process
capability_questions.question: Capability Question How timely is this end-to-end process?

levels.level_1: mandated requirements for timeliness (i.e., the process achieves results within the time specified by law or regulation).
levels.level_2: of automation. Timeliness exceeds legal requirements.
levels.level_3: collaboration, use of information sharing, standards, and regional information exchange hubs. Timeliness exceeds Level 2.
levels.level_4: time. Processes that use clinical information result in immediate action, response, and results. SMA has regional interoperability, which further improves timeliness over Level 3.
levels.level_5: Processes improve further through connectivity with other States and with federal agencies. Most processes execute at the point of service. Results are almost immediate.

levels.level_1: disparate systems including paper storage and obtains information manually.
levels.level_2: disparate systems, but automation and HIPAA standards increase accessibility over Level 1. Manage Registry

capability_questions.question: Capability Question What is the cost to perform the process compared to the benefits of the results?

levels.level_3: standards further improving cost effectiveness ratio over Level 2.
levels.level_4: standards for regional registry exchange improving cost effectiveness ratio over Level 3.
levels.level_5: standards for national (and international) registry exchange improving cost effectiveness ratio over level 4.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Effort to Perform; Efficiency
capability_questions.question: How efficient is the process?

levels.level_1: Process is labor intensive. There is wasted effort or expense to accomplish tasks. Process meets minimum state process guidelines and SMA performance standards. Efficiency
levels.level_2: Automation and state standards increase productivity. SMA focuses more on analyzing information and issuing alerts for detected issues. Efficiency is higher than Level 1. Manage Registry
levels.level_3: SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards and information exchange with intrastate registry agencies and entities improving efficiency to 95% or higher.
levels.level_4: SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards and information exchange with regional registry agencies and entities improving efficiency to 98% or higher.
levels.level_5: SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards and information exchange with national registry agencies and entities improving efficiency to 98% or higher.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Data Access and Accuracy
capability_questions.question: Capability Question How accurate are the results of the process?

levels.level_1: opportunity for human error. Accuracy is low.
levels.level_2: business rules definitions reduce error and improve accuracy above Level 1.
levels.level_3: standards and information exchange with intrastate registry agencies and entities improving accuracy to 90% or higher.
levels.level_4: standards and information exchange with regional registry agencies and entities improving accuracy to 98% or higher.
levels.level_5: standards and information exchange with national registry agencies and entities improving accuracy to 98% or higher.

capability_questions.category: Business Capability Quality: Utility or Value to Stakeholders
capability_questions.question: Does the business process satisfy stakeholders?

levels.level_1: information negatively affecting stakeholder satisfaction with the process.
levels.level_2: provides clear and useful information. Stakeholder satisfaction is greater than Level 1. Manage Registry
levels.level_3: standards and information exchange with intrastate registry agencies and entities improving stakeholder satisfaction to 90% or higher. SMA uses survey or
levels.level_4: standards and information exchange with regional registry agencies and entities improving stakeholder satisfaction to 95% or higher.
levels.level_5: standards and information exchange with national registry agencies and entities improving stakeholder satisfaction to 98% or higher.
